titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Center for the Prevention of Premature Arteriosclerosis (CPPA)
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Center for the Prevention of Premature Arteriosclerosis (CPPA) FA878

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-27 00:03:22 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Center for the Prevention of Premature Arteriosclerosis (CPPA)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical (forms) and numerical (microfilms) order.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Recieved or inventoried in August, 1976. Additional processing 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Center for the Prevention of Premature Arteriosclerosis (CPPA) was established in 1971 by The Rockefeller University, Albert Einstein College of Medicine, College of Physicians and Surgeons, primarily, but also Cornell University Medical College and New York University Medical School.

The program at the Central Clinic at The Rockefeller University is one of the 15 SCOR (Specialized Centers of Research) programs in arteriosclerosis that are supported throughout the country by the National Heart and Lung Institute of the National Institutes of Health.

The program is guided by an Executive Committee consisting of the Principal Investigator, Edward H. Ahrens; the Medical Director, Robert Palmer; Howard A. Eder of Albert Einstein and DeWitt S. Goodman of Columbia University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Patient Consent forms which consist of explanation of program and responsibilities of patient and routines to be followed, signed by patient and physician.

did.unittitle: Microfilms of complete medical charts and patient records except X-rays

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: These are Master films; another set at Central clinic.
